ygData.subject: Re: Exp question
ygData.msgSnippet: I have found killing things that are blue and poisonous or immune to normal weapons increases the amount of experience you get as well.  Significantly
ygData.messageBody:
I have found killing things that are blue and poisonous or immune to normal
weapons increases the amount of experience you get as well. Significantly
:)

> ----------
> From: Bard[SMTP:dabard@...]
> Reply To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Sent: Saturday, June 26, 1999 2:22 PM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: [eqbards] Exp question
>
> From: "Bard" <dabard@...>
>
> I've noticed that when I hunt one thing (for instance, blue-con gnoll
> revers in EK), my experience slowly crawls upward depending very little on
> the con. Now, if I happen to mix up the kills a bit (mebbe kill a war
> wolf
> that's a light blue or dark green-con, or a lion, or pretty much anything
> else that will give exp but is not a gnoll of some type), my experience
> jumps! I've made around a bubble to 2 bubbles of exp over a 2-hour
> (killing
> blue cons, mostly) by doing this, while just going after only 1 type of
> creature (despite the con or creature) gets me less than half the exp.
> Has
> anyone else noticed this or have an explanation?
> -=B=-
> NOR Bard, Esq.
> Proud Owner of New Magical Weapons (thanks to the advice from this list!)
> Back to 17th (Damn that DVinn!)
> The Rathe
>
>
